name: Estancia La Jolla Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really beatiful property, and I particularly enjoyed the live music by the outdoor fireplace. The room decor is substandard for this price range, though, and service is very indifferent. The food is far better (and a far better value) in the village of La Jolla. Please note this hotel is a substantial distance from the village.
reviews.title: Over-rated

likes.liked: — Architecture, outdoor fireplace, and live music

reviews.text: This was a beautiful hotel. We loved the hotel, the pool and spa/ The beds were so comfortable after a long day of site seeing. Beautiful fireplaces, live music and outdoor dining. Close to the Scripps Aquarium,. Nearby there are plenty of places to eat and shop in La Jolla. We drove down to San Diego for the zoo and sea world and up to LA. Good location. Close to the beach. You need a car to get around.
reviews.title: Loved It

likes.liked: — It was truly a luxurious hotel

reviews.title: A Really Beautiful, Relaxed Resort- Loved it
reviews.text: I stayed three nights and found it a fantastic place. Everyone was super nice to me, they worked hard to give me a room with a great view of a courtyard, and I personally loved the southern california mission architecture and style- i thought it was incredibly stylish. The beds, with crisp white sheets and duvet, was amazing. Overall, everyone was great- and this hotel had the best room service breakfast i've ever ordered. I know this sounds overly effusive but I just loved my stay there- for the room, the hotel, and the people. And I have pretty high standards. My only complaint was that the free internet wireless signal was pretty weak in my room- i almost considered asking for a new room with a stronger signal.

We staying with my daughter (5) and my niece (12) and had a really enjoyable time. Sadly when we checked in they only had a room facing the parking lot. When I called to see if we could move to a room closer to the pool area or the court yard, they didn't have anything left.
reviews.title: Lovely California style

likes.liked: — Several options for dinning - all of them good

reviews.text: The girls loved the activities by the pool (tie dying tshirts and face painting) and my husband and I had a great massage at the spa - Charlie is fabulous!! We enjoyed the wonderful breakfast we ordered at the main restaurant - presented beautifully and really delicious. We also had dinner in the courtyard/patio of the Mexican restaurant. Live music and good food made it a real treat for all of us.
reviews.title: Great location, Book spa in advance

likes.liked: — Book your spa treatments in advance!! They sell out.

reviews.text: The hotel property is charming. The rooms are clean and decent size and the staff is friendly and helpful especially the valets. We stayed in a room facing the courtyard - I thought it was not very private.
reviews.title: Good for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness center is extremely small and not great equipments but the spa was nice and quiet. However, the treatments received were adequate.
reviews.title: Very nice property but staff is poor on followthrough

likes.liked: — Property atmosphere, gardens, room (a little small but loved our balcony)

reviews.text: We stayed there for 6 nights over Christmas. We found the food to be quite good, if a little overpriced, however we only ate breakfast and lunch there.
reviews.title: OK but be careful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also visited the spa several times and had inconsistent experiences. The first time the women's locker room was very messy with empty plates of food out by the hot tub and the steam room full of used towels (gross!). On 2nd visit it was fine. On 3rd visit we had an issue with the massage and contacted the manager to discuss but never heard back.
reviews.title: Nice Resort, Good Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At one point our room was cleaned and no toilet paper was left in the room (even on the actual spindle!). We called housekeeping during the afternoon but had to call again at 10 p.m. to get it. Again -- poor follow through.
reviews.title: My only complaint was the food!!

reviews.text: Bought the package off luxury link, the public areas and grounds are an 8/10, the rooms are high end motel, low quality firniture and lamps, IKEA quality. Service was prompt and efficient, but difficult to overcome the disappointment in a poorly furnished room without a separate shower and a refrigerator without a mini bar.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, a high end motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This could be the nicest hotel I have ever stayed atb in all my years of travel.
reviews.title: The Museum Hotel in Wellington, NZ

reviews.text: We spent 5days/4 nights there last February.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in La Jolla

reviews.text: Booked via the internet I was at first reluctant from the pictures provided but what a mistake it would have been to not experience this superlative facility.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, inconsistent service

reviews.text: Ideally located I can still see myself on the balcony off my bedroom with my feet up and a glass of Penfolds in hand. Incredible sweeping views. To the right the road in from the airport framed in majestic hills reminiscent of the Amalfi Coast. Directly in front a bay, boats and mountains on the other side. To my left nearly directly below me the famed Te Papa Museum.
reviews.title: Thank You, Estancia!
A Warm Welcome
reviews.text: After a long travel day, beginning with a cranky limo driver who didn't want to come up our snowy drive, highway gridlock and a delayed flight, we absolutely felt the tensions melt away when greeted by the lovely front desk associate, who offered us a tall flute of sparkling rose! This was the first lobby we have ever been in that smelled good! And the ambience continued with the fire in the fireplace and the clearly California decor.

We walked to our room, on ground level, thru a tranquil garden courtyard. Lots of walkways.Valet park -or-a walking trip. Bags were there before we were. The room was extremely well laid out; we entered thru the front window wall and the closet and bath were at the back wall. Lovely amenities, great lighting and mirror in bath, very comfortable.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds!
Nice relaxing weekend at Estancia
reviews.text: Room service spa breakfast was wonderful-eggwhite omelet with bits of spinach , tomato and chicken apple sausage, muffin and beautiful fruit cup and smoothies! We preferred this to the restaurant breakfast or buffet.. We had dinner one night in the Adobe Grill. I liked the sturdy tableside purse stand for giant handbags. Menu was basic beef, fish etc. offerings, nicely presented. i chose halibut with gnocchi, accented by asparagus tips. baby bok choy., lotus root, mushrooms. Salads were huge. Also went out to Jakes Del Mar (yes, Jakes Lake Tahoe is same restaurant).

reviews.title: One of my favorite places in San Diego
reviews.text: I spent a warm and sunny afternoon by the pool and forgot it was February. I had the hot stone massage at the spa, always a good service, not the aggressive sort of massage that leaves me worn out. Spa has a private, women's only small hot tub. Gym looked adequate-no one was there, it was too lovely a day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had a courtesy van; i availed myself of it for a trip to downtown LaJolla and the contemporary art museum (Chicago MCA is world-class, not a fair comparison), but La Jolla ticket was good for 3 days at several museums.
reviews.title: Met most of my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one evening last week and found the hotel to be terrific. I was impressed with the room comfort and amenities for the price range (upper $200s). The bed was extremely comfortable and the room itself was bright and relaxing.
reviews.title: Wonderful brief stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not get to take advantage of the pool or spa but both appeared to be beautiful. We had dinner at the grill and breakfast at the more formal restaurant - service was top-notch at both and the food was delicous.
reviews.title: Enjoyable but not hitting on all cylinders

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we did not stay for long, I would definitely recommend the hotel for families and/or couples that would like to explore San Diego/La Jolla.
reviews.title: serene, lovely, friendly

reviews.text: My spouse and I stayed at this property for a three-night getaway. The grounds and common areas are lovely. The room was adequate and outfitted with appropriate toiletries, robes, coffee, tea, etc. The commode has a door that separates it from the sink and shower area, which is nice. The gym is small but has everything you need (treadmills, ellipticals, weights, mats). The spa experience was excellent (we both had massages) with smooth reservation and check-in processes, good therapists, and a very well done facility. The pool (salt-water, and heated) was lovely and the surrounding areas very comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful place!

reviews.text: All-in-all we had a pleasant stay, but not one that met our expectations for a property of this level. A couple of specific comments:
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.disliked: — very long walk from the reception area to the elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When staying at a hotel, the first thing I expect (especially being located near the ocean) was precisely ocean front view. The grounds and overall Spanish-Colonial overall features of La Estancia Hotel & Spa certainly made up for it :)
reviews.title: A great staycation!

reviews.text: Great location, and close to downtown La Jolla, which has wonderful restaurants, some with great views of the ocean. Service is generally good, with the exception of the breakfast in Adobe - they are always very slow, so allow extra time. The food is excellent though. Really nice pool and big hot tub, and the grounds are gorgeous - well-kept and feel like a botanical garden.
reviews.title: Unbeatable for visits to UCSD

reviews.text: Enjoyed the facility and the pool was nice and big. The rooms are charming and the staff very friendly and helpful. It's in a beautiful hidden location that has been designed for peace and quite.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise on the service, room and a good value!

reviews.text: Good value with good accents!!
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: My experience at the Estancia La Jolla was good. The Estancia is beautiful. The ambiance and decor are tasteful and unique. I was impressed with the variety of plants and the real candles in the lanterns. The service was excellent! All staff members I encountered were attentive and pleasant. The grounds of the Estancia are amazing. I had a standard king room and it was nice although nothing over the top special. The room was clean, bed was comfy and I had a little Juliet balcony that overlooked the courtyard. The inside of my room did not match the beauty of the campus outside. It was adequate although I would have hoped for something a bit more special. Overall I recommend this hotel. I went running each morning and felt safe and enjoyed the beauty of the surrounding area. Parking is $20.00 per day for self park and $25.00 per day for valet - used the valet, they did a great job. HIghly recommend!
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Estancia is my first choice for a staycation...I first planned a few meetings and conferences there and found that the service was consistently excellent. I also reserve rooms there for our trustees who travel to join us for meetings, and they say nothing but good things. As a university staff member, money is indeed an object. I have a discount card that allows me to stay for a great rate, and even though I whip out my card at check-in and at the restaurants, everyone I encounter on the staff goes out of their way to be helpful and treat me like a VIP. My fiance and I stayed over the weekend of our wedding, and it was a very special and memorable stay. The food is good (stuffed french toast, empanadas, margarita organica, Estancia private label bubbly, I could go on...), and I love the spa. When friends visit me they love to stay at the Estancia too.
reviews.title: Staycation paradise!

reviews.text: Beautiful property with a true old-school Southern California feel. The room service and the mustangs and burros restaurant were both fantastic. The gym is very tiny and underwhelming, especially for a resort in this part of the world. Also, this hotel is not as close to the beach as i had originally thought. However, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the estancia and would readily recommend it to people visiting UCSD, as it is literally across the street.
reviews.title: Best place to stay when visiting UCSD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a wonderful relaxing experience. The people were friendly and helpful, the food and service was fantastic. We can't wait to come back.
reviews.title: Awonderful relaxing vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at the Estancia, we really enjoy the hotel. Nice grounds, the staff are amazing.The food is good.We had a problem with the thermostat in our room not working and they were very helpful and moved us with no problems.The hotel is very clean.They are big on being green and they even recycle plastic and bottles which I thing is teriffic.I will go back!
reviews.title: Estancia La Jolla is a lovelly,quiet get away hotel. The staff will go the distance to make sure you are comfortable.

reviews.text: This place was perfect for our vacation. It is not only beautiful, but the staff makes you feel so comfortable. Great food and service. I really can't say enough about how great our experience was.
reviews.title: Couldn't have stayed at a better place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel via SniqueAway.com when looking for a quick getaway to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. I booked the Sunday at the special rate. I called the hotel and they were able to give me a discounted rate for our second night even though the site said it was unavailable. A special nod to Raquel from reservations for making a special effort for us. Then I called the spa to book a couples massage and they were friendly and able to accommodate a late appointment. When we first arrived, we were greeted by friendly, amiable staff. The valet staff offered us bottled water every time we left. We were checked in quickly and found our room to be quite comfortable and well appointed, even fresh flower petals sprinkled over the bed. We didn't get a room overlooking the courtyard and pool, but it didn't matter at all. It's not like you get a ocean view or anything. The hotel is located about a 10 min drive from downtown La Jolla, but it was easy to find.
reviews.title: Wonderful La Jolla!

reviews.text: We went for a quick bite to eat at the Bodega wine bar. I have to say the food there was absolutely delicious and excellent value for the money. The alcoholic beverages were top notch! The service was terrific. We also went back for a light dinner after the massage. The spa provided a locker, cozy terry robes and plastic slippers. The amenities included body lotion, hair dryers, brushes, shower gels, shampoo and conditioners, feminine hygiene products (but no face moisturizer). They had a relaxation room with hot tea and cool water. I enjoyed the steam room with the provided ice cooled face cloths. Very clean facilities. I did not use the hot tub. The masseuses were professional, competent and very attentive. Excellent experience and well worth the price.
reviews.title: Beautiful, cozy, and homey. Wonderful place to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to mention there was some noise throughout the night though not from other people - sounded more like maintenance trolleys or something. The king size bed was nice,but not as top quality as a heavenly bed at the Westin hotels.
reviews.title: I purchased this special on Groupon, which was excellent. For 22 anv. and B-day

reviews.text: We couldn't get the safe to work but they sent someone right away when I called. Of course, the moment he left, we couldn't get it to work again, but no matter. Also, the previous guest had programmed the alarm to go off super early, so I had a heck of a time trying to turn it off in the dark. Hah! Gotta check that next time!
reviews.title: One of the best I've stayed

reviews.text: One thing that I've never had before was that there was no booklet in the room listing the hotel services or room service, so I had no idea if they had room service or not. One pleasant surprise was that you could crank open the windows for fresh air.
reviews.title: My forwarding address is…

aka: Estancia La Jolla Hotel La Jolla
description: A California-coastal rancho setting on 10 acres conveniently located between the two quaint seaside villages of La Jolla and Del Mar and adjacent to world-class Torrey Pines Golf Course, Estancia La Jolla Hotel & Spa offers a range of upscale accommodations from charming rancho style deluxe rooms to expansive suites with world-class facilities and exceptional service.
